alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Grant; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 6:22PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Arthur, southern Grant and Keith Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 521 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms producing a landspout along a line extending from near Arthur to near Lemoyne to 9 miles southeast of Big Springs. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ogallala, Arthur, Brule, Keystone, Kingsley Dam, Lemoyne, Roscoe, Swede Lake, Cogill Lake, Megeath, Green Lake, Bucktail Lake, Three Mile Lake, Pratt Lake, Eagle Gulch Campground, Haythorn Lake, Lena, Sand Puddin Lake, Nevens and Broganville. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 80 and 155. Highway 92 between mile markers 124 and 178. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 112 and 142. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for southwestern and west central Nebraska.
